context: The Finnish verb 'suosia' means to favor, or to prefer something. It is a transitive verb, meaning it takes an object. The word can be conjugated in various tenses and moods as shown in the dictionary definition. For example, 'Suosin tummapaahtoista kahvia' translates to 'I prefer dark roasted coffee'. The -s- within the word is an irregular filler consonant.
